description: Following Halden's death and credential failure, BCI outages spread across key districts. Council members are called to emergency session as daily life is disrupted.
Sven Halek blocks automated ritual-messaging. He urges the Council to publicly admit system instability and announces a freeze on compliance scores while the issue is investigated.

Authorities release a rare public statement: BCI scoring is frozen due to technical problems. The announcement sparks uncertainty as citizens begin to report access issues and delayed services citywide.
Repeated BCI outages result in major transport slowdowns and stalled services. Frustration rises as residents are denied routine transactions and access to key facilities.

Council factions split over recovery. The Innovators push for rapid software fixes; Directorate launches manual compliance patrols to restore basic order, creating visible confusion and tension in affected neighborhoods.
